Lonely #14 C, the Sincline Video

Posted on April 7, 2012 by mike

As promised…here’s a video of the previous shoot with Mo & Steph as captured by my buddy Scott. It’s pretty quick…but might help you all imagine what life’s like out on the Lonely Road. Standing around naked, cameras rolling….pretty fun. And his commentary is awesome. The video cuts off right before the motorcycle guy showed up….bummer. So, go back to entry #14 B and see what transpired right after this video!

Enjoy…..

Lonely Road Action as captured by Cookie

  1. mp3juice on June 4, 2016 at 1:19 pm said:

    First of all I want to say terrific blog! I had a
    quick question that I’d like to ask if you
    don’t mind. I was curious to know how you center yourself and clear your head before writing.
    I’ve had a difficult time clearing my mind in getting my thoughts out there.
    I do enjoy writing but it just seems like the first 10
    to 15 minutes are wasted simply just trying to
    figure out how to begin. Any ideas or tips? Many thanks!

    Reply ↓
    • mike on June 22, 2016 at 11:22 am said:

      Oh, man…..sometimes I freeze up on this stuff too. What I’ve found is best for me is to “think” about an entry for a week or two, jot down ideas, and then come back to it several times before I sit down and write. I find that “revisiting” an idea a few times before committing myself to writing allows more ideas and variations to pop into my mind which in turn helps me to better tell my story. So, i’ll review tons of photos, think about the scenario, keep re-looking at the photos and considering others….and over a couple of weeks my story typically comes together! Like, the Pathfinder entry I’m starting today.

      Reply ↓
